;哥伦比亚小队据称枪杀海地总统两年后，厄瓜多尔当局指责一群哥伦比亚人是暗杀一名高级总统候选人的幕后黑手，指出政治打工文化的输出。

;

;哥伦比亚有着政客被反对派、毒贩、毒贩暗杀的悠久历史。或准军事组织，甚至总统古斯塔沃·佩特罗 (Gustavo Petro) 在当选前都在防弹盾墙后面进行竞选活动。

;

;周三厄瓜多尔记者兼反腐败斗士费尔南多·比亚维森西奥 (Fernando Villavicencio) 遭到令人震惊的暗杀后，当局公布了照片六名哥伦比亚嫌疑人，其中一人浑身是血。

;

;第七名嫌疑人在犯罪现场的枪战中被打死。

;

;该国的主要报纸《El Universo》据报道，比亚维森西奥被“杀手式暗杀，头部中了三枪”。

;

;警方表示，嫌疑人在一系列突袭中被捕，他们还发现了一支步枪、一把机关枪、手榴弹和

;

;厄瓜多尔总统候选人在竞选活动中被暗杀

;

;在支持厄瓜多尔的信息中，委内瑞拉总统尼古拉斯·马杜罗将其与海地总统若韦内尔·莫伊兹被谋杀直接联系起来。 2021 年 7 月，一群 17 名哥伦比亚雇佣兵回到家中。

;

;“一伙哥伦比亚杀手、雇佣兵前往海地刺杀总统，”他在一次官方活动中说道。

;

;“不幸的是，这些杀手犯罪团伙正在将这种哥伦比亚模式的政治暗杀带到境外。”

;

;哥伦比亚有组织犯罪调查员豪尔赫·曼蒂拉 (Jorge Mantilla) 表示，逮捕行动表明“​​哥伦比亚犯罪分子在在国家与游击队、准军事组织和贩毒团伙之间长达六十年的武装冲突之后，“使用暴力”。

;

;他说，这两起暗杀事件“显示了这些暴力专业人士与跨国犯罪网络联系的能力。 ”

;

;比亚维森西奥上周表示，他收到了来自 Los Choneros 的多次威胁，Los Choneros 是厄瓜多尔最强大的犯罪集团之一，洞察犯罪智囊团称该组织已成为哥伦比亚贩毒集团的武装派别。它还与墨西哥的锡那罗亚贩毒集团有联系。

;

;周五晚些时候，比亚维森西奥在一个私人仪式上被埋葬在基多，数百人在展览中心悼念，他的棺材上覆盖着国旗和象征性的总统雕像腰带上写着“我的权力在于宪法”。

;

;虽然没有明确声称对此事负责，但这起谋杀案凸显了这个曾经和平的国家已沦为贩毒和有组织犯罪的暴力温床.

;

;夹在主要可卡因生产国哥伦比亚和秘鲁之间的厄瓜多尔（被视为管制较宽松）近年来吸引了外国贩毒集团，这些贩毒集团与当地帮派勾结，通过该国将毒品运往美国国家和欧洲。

;

;曼蒂拉解释说，厄瓜多尔贩毒团伙“通过与哥伦比亚组织合作获得权力，后来独立”并变得更加强大。

;

;周四，厄瓜多尔内政部长胡安·萨帕塔简单地将这些被拘留者称为“外国人”，并称他们是“犯罪集团的成员”，该集团暗杀了比亚维森西奥，“企图破坏”即将于 8 月 20 日举行的总统选举。

;

;哥伦比亚媒体称，嫌疑人在本国有犯罪记录，包括武器制造和贩运、贩毒、谋杀或家庭暴力。

;

;海地暗杀事件发生后，美国的一项调查显示，迈阿密保安部门负责人的两名男子公司制定了一项计划，绑架莫伊兹，并用一名海地裔美国公民取代他。

;

;哥伦比亚毒枭与巴勃罗·埃斯科巴在美国监狱被判处 45 年徒刑

;

;今年 3 月拥有海地和智利双重国籍的鲁道夫·贾尔在美国承认为哥伦比亚突击队提供庇护并向他们提供武器。

;

;同月，哥伦比亚总统佩特罗表示，哥伦比亚对莫伊塞的暗杀负有部分责任。

;

; >;

;“哥伦比亚负有共同责任……哥伦比亚雇佣军刺杀了海地总统，引发了一场比他们已经经历的危机更严重的危机，”他说。

;

;佩特罗尚未对厄瓜多尔暗杀事件发表评论。

;台湾决定通过延长服役期来保留老化的幻影 2000-5 战斗机面对来自人民解放军日益增长的压力，目前的生活已经过时了。

;

;但此举引发了一场争论，即在应对来自迅速崛起的军队的挑战时，此举是否会浪费金钱。现代化的解放军空军。

;

;本月早些时候，台湾空军证实已与法国制造商达索航空公司签署了价值 1.5 亿新台币（480 万美元）的合同，以评估延长部分飞机寿命的可能性

;

;最初，评估将集中于 9 架双座飞机，根据合同，评估预计将于 2026 年 7 月完成。

;

;“双座飞机台湾空军参谋长曹展平中将在 8 月 1 日表示：“延长后的 20 年里，座位将有利于作战。”

;

;曹展平表示，空军希望首先是延长双座飞机的使用寿命，以便它们既可以用于常规任务，也可以用于新兵训练。

;

;台湾从台湾购买了 60 架幻影 2000-5，其中包括 12 架双座飞机达索公司于1992年向该岛交付飞机，但直到1997年，在北京的强烈抗议下，这家法国公司才开始向该岛交付飞机。此后，其中六架飞机在坠机中受损，但仍有 54 架仍在运行。

;

;这些飞机存放在台湾北部的新竹空军基地，负责保卫台北、新北等地区、基隆和宜兰。

;

;这些战机目前已处于生命周期后期，其维护和修理成本远远超过台湾空军使用的其他主力飞机。

;

;台湾空军内部对于是否让整个机队退役存在争议，因为这些飞机不仅运行和维护成本高昂，更重要的是与台湾使用的美国武器系统不兼容

;

;一位不愿透露姓名的空军消息人士表示，这架喷气式飞机曾经被认为是最先进的，拥有尖端技术，使其能够从相对较短的跑道快速爬升，演习其“卓越的敌方交战能力，包括射击和跟踪”。

;

;当它在 90 年代末服役时，它远远优于台湾制造的本土防御战斗机 (IDF) 喷气机和 F-16消息人士补充说，A/B 喷气式飞机是从美国购买的。

;

;但在台湾升级了 IDF 喷气式飞机并将其 F-16 A/B 式飞机更换为 F-16 Vipers 后，幻影喷气式飞机失去了优势。

;

;消息人士称，“更糟糕的是，该机每小时的运行和维护成本是空军战机中最高的。”

;

;据空军内部人士透露，幻影运行一小时的成本为新台币 80 万（25,000 美元），而以色列国防军的成本为新台币 25 万，F-16 的成本为新台币 16 万，而且这还不包括由于缺乏备用部件而导致的维护成本很高。;

;消息人士称，由于达索公司不再拥有“幻影”生产线，台湾很难获得维护飞机所需的零部件。

;

;退役空军张彦廷中将表示，延长飞机的使用寿命是浪费金钱。

;

;“延长寿命只是一种维护，与升级相比效果有限。”他补充道，面对快速现代化的解放军空军，幻影根本无法与歼20等大陆更强大的战机相抗衡。

;

;“为什么不一劳永逸地更新幻影，而不是一劳永逸地更新幻影？”浪费钱来延长寿命？”他说。

;

;中国大陆播放纪录片，暗示准备攻击台湾

;

;新北淡江大学国际关系与战略研究教授林英宇表示，空军表示应记住，退役法国飞机可能会导致其在等待替换飞机时资源不足。

;

;“由于解放军几乎每天都会出动台湾，退役所有幻影并不是一个简单的事情。 “这是明智之举，因为空军仍然需要派遣战机来跟踪任何接近的敌机并确保台湾的安全。”他说。

;

;尽管台湾已从美国订购了 66 架 F-16V 喷气式飞机，可以取代幻影战斗机林说，退役后，将它们运送到岛上还需要一段时间，并补充说，运送也有延迟的担忧。

;

;美国本来应该派遣第一艘台湾国防部强调，所有 66 架战机仍预计在 2026 年底前如期抵达，但今年年底前将交付两架战斗机，但此后推迟到 2024 年第三季度。

;

;台湾一直受到来自北京的军事压力，北京将台湾视为其领土的一部分，需要对其进行控制——必要时可以使用武力。包括美国在内的大多数国家并不认为台湾是一个独立国家，而且反对以武力改变现状。

;下周抵达香港的邮轮运营商必须提供乘客的首选市旅游局局长表示，为避免启德码头出现拥堵，请提前安排出行选择，如有需要可安排分批下船。

;

;文化体育旅游局局长杨润雄周六，发誓要从最近邮轮码头物流惨败中汲取教训，并表示，随着大型游轮海洋光谱号于 8 月 19 日抵达，政府一直在努力改善乘客服务。

;

;“最后周六，大量旅客在航站楼等候较长时间……这对城市形象和旅游业造成了影响。我们立即介入，改善那里的交通安排。”他在电台节目中说道。

;

;“考虑到下周六的另一次游轮访问，我们将吸取教训……可以安排乘客在以下时间下船：如果需要的话，可以分批次进行，这样他们就不需要在酷热的天气下在码头外长时间排队。”

;

;码头运营商应监控情况，并通知即将到来的 5,000 名邮轮，并非所有邮轮都已抵达。如果进城交通出现瓶颈，乘客将被放行。

;

;杨还承诺改善下船乘客的服务，并表示旅游官员一直在与码头运营商和游轮就不同的计划进行联络提供高效的运输服务。

;

;“我们正在制定加强旅客服务的准备计划。例如，我们要求邮轮为我们提供乘客首选的交通选择，以便我们可以为他们提供选择，例如更多的出租车。”他说。

;

;香港邮轮码头运营商拒绝商业改造，强调作为港口的作用

;

;杨补充说，在收到有关交通网络不佳的投诉后，当局推出了新的班车路线，并为出租车司机提供了现金奖励，游客可以轻松地在码头乘坐公共交通工具。

;

;周末，数百名游轮乘客被迫排队等候城市交通（有时甚至长达 45 分钟），当局于周二晚间宣布，他们将提供 3 条前往主要旅游景点的免费班车路线，并为出租车司机提供香港50 美元（6 美元）的优惠券可用于给油箱加油。

;

;免费巴士在香港邮轮码头减少排队，为乘客提供海上换乘服务

;

;“到目前为止，我们采取的额外措施正在发挥作用很好。你可以看到游客很容易乘坐公共交通工具和出租车，”他说。

;

;“我们将继续关注情况，特别是因为下周六我们将有一个相对较大的游轮抵达。这当然是对我们措施的另一次考验。”

;

;世界一号名胜号将是本月剩余时间停靠在码头的另一艘游轮，海洋光谱号将于 8 月 19 日进行一次访问9 月 23 日返回之前。名胜世界一号将在该月剩余的周三、周五和周日使用该设施。

;香港当局将于9月中旬前对30座建筑物进行紧急维修在发生一系列涉及混凝土坠落的事件后，该市发展部长表示，该建筑未能遵守强制检查令。

;在最新的案例中，周二，旺角脚手架覆盖的新兴大厦的混凝土在十天内第二次掉落，导致一辆巴士的车顶出现一个洞。暂无人员伤亡报告。

;

;“如果存在风险， “一旦发现问题，我们将进行紧急维修，稍后再向业主收回费用。”她补充说，第一批共挑选出30栋楼宇。

;“增加处罚会有帮助吗？我们还没有立场，但业主不应只考虑不遵守命令的处罚，因为如果你的疏忽导致受伤，你需要支付更多费用。”她说。

;香港人郭晶晶*在一周的大部分时间里都会遵守规则。但在周末，她会脱光衣服在公共场所拍摄裸体照片，包括光天化日之下。

;

;她的摄影师是她的男友、金融部门员工Wesley Cheung*。郭认为自己是“slasher”，这个词是用来形容同时从事几份工作的年轻人的。

;

;在过去的五年里，这对 30 多岁的夫妇在社交媒体上发布了 100 多张郭的照片媒体平台 Twitter，最近更名为 X。

;

;它们的位置范围从商业区的著名地标到安静的公园和海滩。中环大会堂旁和尖沙咀东海滨长廊都有郭氏的照片。

;

;网上发布情侣阳台做爱视频，女子被捕

;

;“人口稠密的城市“香港的感觉在拥挤的城市景观和暴露的身体之间产生了更大的对比感，”张说。

;

;这对夫妇是这座城市中数量不详的从事“曝光摄影”的人之一，尽管有些人爱好者们将他们的爱好称为“lou ceot”（广东话），这是对日本 roshutsu 的本地化诠释，指的是在公共场所完全或部分裸体拍摄通常侧重于亲密的照片身体部位。

;

;“身体暴露不一定是色情，”张说，尽管他知道香港有人认为他的照片淫秽和不道德。

;

;是否有违公共道德在香港网络时代还好吗？

;

;郭说，她因为胸部丰满而受到不受欢迎的关注，年轻时，陌生人在街上给她拍照或不雅触摸她。;

;“你们对女性身体这么好奇？让我给你看一下，”她解释道，并解释了自己喜欢被拍裸照的癖好。

;

;然而，就香港法律而言，这种行为是非法的。

;

;不雅行为暴露行为可判处最高六个月的监禁和 2,000 港元（255 美元）的罚款。发布淫秽文章（包括照片）最高可判入狱三年及罚款港币 100 万港元。

;

;3 月，一名 18 岁男学生因涉嫌未经授权发布图片而被捕一名女子在公共图书馆脱衣。

;

;他的镜头来自一段广为流传的视频片段，显示一名身份不明的女子在据信是铜锣湾中央图书馆的地方脱掉衣服并伸手拿书.

;

;6月，一名40岁的女服务员因不雅暴露和发表淫秽文章而被捕，社交媒体平台上发现了120多张她裸体或暴露乳房和生殖器的照片和视频。 .

;

;她在繁忙的街道、公共交通、商店、餐馆和酒店、郊野公园和海滨地区遭到枪击。

;

;两起案件均正在审理中。

;< h3>;香港警方逮捕一名因在繁忙街道、公共交通工具上暴露自己的女子;

;据参与第二起案件的调查人员称，该女子在向警方报案后被捕。然而，由于没有先例，警方必须就有关在线发布淫秽文章的技术法律问题咨询司法部。

;

;该警官表示，警方已发现大约 10 个 Twitter 帐户持有者发布了类似图片。他说，逮捕这名女子是为了起到威慑作用。

;

;郭和张表示，他们并不追求“曝光”金钱的热情，他们的作品也不会出售。

;< p>;他们意识到，一些女性、男性和情侣将他们裸露或进行性行为的照片和视频发布到基于订阅的在线平台上。

;

;“可怜清洁工”：裸体的中国夫妇对擦窗工看到的事情感到愤怒

;

;“这不是我的本意，”张说。对于这对夫妇来说，他们在 Twitter 上的公共账户已经聚集了大约 28,000 名粉丝，这些粉丝主要来自香港、中国大陆、台湾和日本，这已经足够让这对夫妇感到满意了。

;

;张说他只是想展示裸体之美。人体形态与周围环境的映衬。

;

;郭说：“我赤裸的身体融入周围的自然或原始的东西，实际上很美。”

;

;在解释他们如何进行拍摄时，夫妇俩表示，他们会在去某个地点之前提前计划，张会准备好相机。

;

;裸体和阅读：香港图书馆女子的视频促使警方报案

;

;郭然后他会脱掉她的长外套——通常是她唯一的衣服——然后他就会迅速脱开。然后他们会匆匆离开，尽量减少遇到其他人或警察的风险。

;

;然后，他们会选择最好的照片，遮住郭的脸，并将其发布到 Twitter 上，这是最宽容的之一。

;

;郭说，她以前是一个胆怯、缺乏自尊的人，但从人们对她照片的反应中获得了自信。

;

;“很多人‘喜欢’ ’我们贴出照片后，韦斯利对我说，‘看，你没那么糟糕。对自己更有信心。”她说。

;

;临床心理学家 Karen Liem 博士表示，她的同龄人将暴露癖定义为在公共场合暴露自己或进行性行为并从活动中获得性快感的愿望。

;

;她补充说，仅仅在公共场所拍摄裸照并在网上分享的人可能不会被视为暴露狂。

;

;中文大学社会学家莎拉·钟华表示，年轻人认为这是一种暴露狂。在网上拥有众多粉丝是一项成就，但要脱颖而出并不容易。

;

;因此，她补充道，对于某些人来说，在公共场合裸身拍照是吸引眼球的一种方式。

;

;另一位在公共场所拍摄裸体女性的摄影师 Gary Ho* 表示，他通常在网上找到模特，并且已经拍摄了一年。

;

;他最喜欢的照片是在白天在公共住宅区的篮球场拍摄的。 ，展示他的裸体模特在篮筐旁边。

;

;学生在香港图书馆的裸女照片发布到网上后被捕

;

;何承认他出售了一些照片，但表示并不是他的主要收入来源。他说他已经结婚了，但他的妻子对他的爱好一无所知。

;

;40多岁的何说，他的妻子不知道他已经拍了一年这样的照片。

;

;他说他在 Twitter 和 Telegram 上看到了大约 30 个账户，显示类似的图片，给他留下了深刻的印象。

;

;圈子里的摄影师从学生、普通工薪阶层到大企业主，年龄从十几岁到十几岁。 40 多岁，他们的模特通常是他们的女朋友或妻子。

;

;“我们只是普通人，但我们喜欢做一些特别的事情，”他说。 “当你做了一些困难的事情后，你会有一种成就感。”

;

;*应受访者要求，化名。

; Sat, 12 Aug 2023 15:20:02 +0800 Brics challenge to the established economic order is no jokehttps://www.scmp.com/comment/opinion/article/3230669/brics-challenge-established-economic-order-no-joke?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.08.12 15:15;
;;

;金砖国家 – 巴西、俄罗斯、印度、中国和南非 – 很忙刚刚盖了一栋更大的房子，他们的家庭规模看起来将会增加，而且可能会非常显着。但重要的不是规模大小，而是金砖国家成员在不同领域发挥影响力。

;

;一些人认为，金砖国家在国际经济和金融体系改革以及确保更大的影响力方面发挥着更大的影响力。在国际货币狂欢节上为发展中国家发声并投票。它已经成立了新开发银行 (NDB)，成员国正在推动新的货币和储备安排。

;

;据南非最高外交官称，已有 40 多个国家正式申请或表示有兴趣加入金砖国家。负责与欧盟的关系。这些国家包括沙特阿拉伯、伊朗、阿根廷、阿拉伯联合酋长国和印度尼西亚。

;

;2009 年，当金砖四国在没有南非的情况下诞生时，金砖四国在经济上显得过于多元化且地理分散，以至于无法发挥作用。然而，正是这种多样性似乎引导它走向比其他区域集团更加全球化的视角。

;

;在即将举行的第 15 届金砖国家年度峰会之前，评论人士在很大程度上忽视了这些事实。本月晚些时候在南非约翰内斯堡举行。他们更关心俄罗斯总统弗拉基米尔·普京(Vladimir Putin)决定不亲自出席金砖国家峰会。

;

;然而，普京的行动，包括乌克兰战争，不太可能成为峰会的中心舞台，而是有兴趣加入金砖国家的国家如何看待中国国家主席习近平和印度总理纳伦德拉·莫迪在金砖国家的行动。许多新兴经济体现在考虑加入金砖国家的原因之一是，它们厌倦了被哄骗或胁迫在美国和中国之间的分歧以及俄罗斯和乌克兰的对抗中选边站队。

;

;金砖四国是这是一个天然的吸引力极，因为它的主要重点是促进多边主义和全球治理，尤其是在经济和金融领域。然而，一些人认为这些原则现在正处于危险之中，因为中国和印度之间存在明显的竞争，而此时该集团作为世界事务平衡力量的潜在吸引力正处于历史最高水平。

;

;大西洋理事会非常驻高级研究员Hung Tran认为，金砖国家“可能演变成为世界事务中七国集团（G7）的对手，从而对国际关系产生深远影响”。这是积极还是消极取决于中国或印度的做法是否占上风。

;

;Tran 表示，印度“一直试图抵制中国将金砖国家集团转变为中国地缘政治议程的支持组织的努力，例如特兰认为，新德里反而试图将金砖国家的注意力集中在“南南经济和金融”上。合作项目、减少全球对以美元为基础的国际金融和支付体系依赖的举措以及国际金融机构改革以赋予发展中国家更多发言权和代表性”。

;

;这可能是也可能不是准确描述了金砖国家内的中印局势，但这与 2022 年峰会的基调不太相符，当时中国对金砖国家推动全球经济和金融体系改革表示了强烈支持。

;

;因此，巴西也是如此，今年 3 月，巴西前总统迪尔玛·罗塞夫 (Dilma Rousseff) 当选新开发银行行长，此举可能会提升这家总部位于上海的机构的形象，并为该机构带来新成员，该机构的成立是为了调动资源。为新兴市场和发展中国家的基础设施和可持续发展项目提供资金”，已资助了 98 个项目，价值约 332 亿美元。

;

;为什么非洲国家热衷于加入不断扩大的金砖国家俱乐部

;

;罗塞夫强调，新开发银行将致力于以成员国本币提供30%的融资，这与中印两国减少对美元依赖的目标是一致的。

;< p>;罗塞夫出席金砖国家峰会应该成为人们关注的焦点，金砖国家创始国可以通过强调其多边优先事项来团结起来。

;

;2015年，即新开发银行成立的那一年，该集团启动了应急储备金安排 1000 亿美元为出现国际收支问题的成员国提供支持，这有可能为金砖国家成员提供国际货币基金组织之外的替代融资来源。

;

;甚至更早的 2010 年，该集团启动了银行间合作机制便利成员国银行之间以当地货币进行跨境支付和结算。一些成员国也在探索连接其国家支付系统。

;

;在这些方面以及其他方面，包括一些成员国推出央行数字货币，金砖四国与一些区域贸易和投资协定不同。其成员分属各自不同，如《跨太平洋伙伴关系全面进步协定》、《区域全面经济伙伴关系协定》、《亚太印太经济框架》等。

;

;金砖构想应运而生2001 年，高盛 (Goldman Sachs) 的吉姆·奥尼尔 (Jim O'Neil) 建议用这个缩写词来描述四个主要新兴市场（他没有包括南非），当时并没有得到完全认真的对待。现在它们占全球GDP的四分之一以上，现在没有人可以轻松地忽视它们对既定经济秩序的挑战。

;;2023.08.12 14:44;
;;

;Hawaii's chief legal officer said on Friday she was opening a probe into the handling of devastating wildfires that killed at least 67 people in the state this week, as criticism grows of the official response.

;

;The announcement came as residents of Lahaina were allowed back into the town for the first time – with most finding their homes had been reduced to ashes, and even the lucky few angry at a sense of abandonment.

;

;“Everything has been coconut wire,” said William Harry, referring to a system of rumours.

;

;“One person heard, then told another, but it's not official information. They don't come here and explain anything.”

;

;Another man, who did not want to be named, said he felt like he had been left to fend for himself.

;

;“Where is the government?他们在哪里？” he fumed.

;

;“This is insane. We can't move freely, we don't get the support, now we've heard about looting.”

;

;Maui wildfire death toll hits 53, resort town in smouldering ruins

;

;Hawaii's Attorney General Anne Lopez said her office would be examining “critical decision-making and standing policies leading up to, during and after the wildfires on Maui and Hawai'i islands this week.”

;

;“My department is committed to understanding the decisions that were made before and during the wildfires and to sharing with the public the results of this review.”

;

;For some of those who made it back into Lahaina, there was elation as they tearfully reconnected with neighbours they feared might not have got out alive.

;

;“You made it!”奇娜·乔 (Chyna Cho) 在废墟中拥抱安珀·兰登 (Amber Langdon) 时喊道。 “I was trying to find you.”

;

;For some of the luckiest, there was joy – albeit tempered by the scale of the tragedy that counts among the worst natural disasters to hit the state of Hawaii.

;

;“I just couldn't believe it,” Keith Todd said after finding his home intact.

;

;“I'm so grateful, but at the same time it's so devastating.”

;

;Todd, 64, discovered his house and his neighbour's house untouched, and his solar panels providing electricity to the fridge, which was still dispensing ice on demand.

;

;But even those few whose homes still appeared habitable were being warned they might not be safe.

;

;“Some structures in the Lahaina water system were destroyed by the fire … These conditions may have caused harmful contaminants, including benzene and other volatile organic chemicals (VOCs), to enter the water system,” said Maui's water department.

;

;“As a precaution …[we] are advising residents to not use the tap water for drinking and cooking until further notice.”

;

;Some of those who made it back to Lahaina wandered in stunned silence trying to take in the enormity of the destruction.

;

;Anthony La Puente said the shock of finding his home burned to nothing was profound.

;

;“It sucks not being able to find the things you grew up with, or the things you remember,” he said of the house he had lived in for 16 years.

;

;“The only thing I can say is that it hurts. It takes a toll on you emotionally,” the 44-year-old said.

;

;La Puente dug through the still warm ashes of his home, picking out a Starbucks tumbler that had survived, but despairing at the loss of irreplaceable things, like mementoes of his late father.

;

;“I had packed up my dad's belongings” hoping to sort through them at some point, he said.

;

;But that will never happen.

;

;“Now it's gone.”

;

;The confirmed toll rose to 67 on Friday, surpassing the number of people killed when a tsunami struck the Big Island in 1960.

;

;“Without a doubt, there will be more fatalities. We don't know ultimately how many will have occurred,” Governor Josh Green said.

;

;Crews from Honolulu arrived on Maui along with search and rescue teams equipped with K-9 cadaver dogs, Maui county said.

;

;Firefighters were continuing to extinguish flare-ups and contain wildfires in Lahaina, with spot blazes evident to the AFP team in the town.

;

;Maui county police chief John Pelletier said on Thursday that as many as 1,000 people could be unaccounted for, though he stressed that this did not mean they were missing or dead.

;

;Communications in the western part of the island remain tricky, and Pelletier said many of those whose whereabouts were not known could simply be out of reach.

;

;The fires follow other extreme weather events in North America this summer, with record-breaking wildfires still burning across Canada and a major heatwave baking the US southwest.

;

;Europe and parts of Asia have also endured soaring temperatures, with major fires and floods wreaking havoc.

; Sat, 12 Aug 2023 14:50:02 +0800 Body art brouhaha: China track goddess Wu Yanni hits back at ‘bad girl’ tattoo taunts saying ink job is symbol of ‘confidence’https://www.scmp.com/news/people-culture/china-personalities/article/3230613/body-art-brouhaha-china-track-goddess-wu-yanni-hits-back-bad-girl-tattoo-taunts-saying-ink-job?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.08.12 14:00;
;;

;Chinese athlete Wu Yanni, who won silver in the 100m women's hurdles in World University Games, has hit back at critics of her “bad girl” tattoo, saying the body art is a symbol of her self-confidence.

;

;Wu, 26, has been dubbed China's goddess of track and field because of her good looks and outgoing personality.

;

;The athlete set a new personal best of 12.76 seconds in the women's 100m hurdles final at the FISU World University Games in Chengdu, the capital city of southwestern China's Sichuan province, on August 4.

;

;The result also ensures Wu's qualification for the Paris Olympics, which has a 12.77-second entry requirement.

;

;However, rather than her landmark sporting achievement, some people have focused on her right arm.

;

;During her hurdling heroics, Wu hid her tattoo – a crown surrounded by blooming flowers to signify victory – with a covering of red tape.

;

;Some criticised her with comments such as “only bad girls have tattoos” or “her tattoo has bad influence on children” and “even gang members don't have tattoos now”.

;

;China bans people aged under 18 from being inked and has outlawed the showing of tattoos on TV, in live-streams, or in videos on social media.

;

;However, China's General Administration of Sport has only officially banned footballers from the practice. The country's legendary tennis player, Li Na, and badminton player, Lin Dan, both sport tattoos.

;

;Wu openly talked about the issue in an interview with state broadcaster China Central Television (CCTV) two years ago, saying: “I am confident in myself. I don't have that tattoo for nothing.”

;

;Wu broke her personal best twice during this year's World University Games, which was postponed twice from 2021 due to the Covid-19 pandemic.

;

;She first surpassed her personal best of 12.86 seconds in the semifinals by 0.01 second, then broke it again in the final.

;

;Besides her tattoo, Wu's sophisticated makeup has also become a target of judgemental critics.

;

;The athlete responded in an August 5 interview with the media outlet Southern People Weekly, saying she wore makeup out of “respect for each event and to show the best of herself on the most important occasions.”

;

;“Why do athletes have to prove how hardworking they are with a suntanned face?现在时代不同了。 A confident athlete moves the audience more than a successful result,” added Wu.

;

;On mainland social media, people showed their support for Wu's body art.

;

;“Since when did tattoos become a criterion to decide the nature of a person?” asked one online observer.

;

;“Just look at her performance and stop staring at her arm,” said another.

;

;“I even support her removing the tape to completely show herself as she is. It is not for you old fogeys to judge such a beautiful woman,” commented a supporter.

; Sat, 12 Aug 2023 14:20:01 +0800 China corruption watchdog nabs 160 hospital bosses in healthcare blitzhttps://www.scmp.com/news/china/politics/article/3230757/china-corruption-watchdog-nabs-160-hospital-bosses-healthcare-blitz?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.08.12 14:00;
;;

;Chinese anti-corruption investigators have netted more than 160 hospital bosses this year, as Beijing targets the lucrative medical sector, which received public funding worth billions of US dollars under Covid-19.

;

;Sources and observers expect more heads to roll in the sector, which has been one of the largest sources of public grievances over high costs and rampant corruption.

;

;State media reports said more than 150 hospital bosses and secretaries have been identified in the targeted campaign that began earlier this year, but tallies by the South China Morning Post suggest the total may have reached 168 this week.

;

;It was also reported last month that at least two senior pharmaceutical company executives – Winning Health Technology Group chairman Zhou Wei and Fan Zhihe, chairman of Shanghai Serum Bio-Technology – were under investigation for alleged corruption.

;

;The sector-specific anti-corruption campaign kicked off just months after China emerged from its three-year zero-Covid strategy, but stepped up a gear as a July 30 deadline neared for people to hand themselves over in exchange for leniency.

;

;'So broken': virus exposes 'serious deficiencies' in Chinese healthcare

;

;Data released in March by the National Health Commission showed health facilities across the country have received more than 110 billion yuan (US$15.2 billion) since 2020.

;

;A source – who asked for anonymity because of the matter's sensitivity – said the campaign to rid the sector of systemtic corruption will continue into 2024.

;

;“The campaign will continue for another 10 months and the investigators will report to the leadership next June. New rules and regulations will be introduced based on the results of the investigation,” the source said.

;

;“So, more heads of health commissions, hospitals and medical suppliers will roll in the coming months.”

;

;The urgency of the anti-corruption campaign was reflected in a notice issued last month by the Guangdong Health Commission, which gave major hospitals and medical bodies in the southern province two days to review an audit report of their finances.

;

;“You must provide feedback officially even if you have no objections,” the notice said.

;

;Here are 3 anti-corruption tools in China's arsenal that may be underutilised

;

;A Guangdong health official, who asked not to be identified because he is not authorised to speak publicly, said authorities had promised leniency for hospital bosses and officials who surrendered before August.

;

;Cross-agency collaboration in the campaign underlines the clear mandate from the country's leadership for the anti-corruption drive.

;

;On July 15, the finance ministry issued a joint notice with the National Medical Insurance Administration ordering spot checks of local medical funds and a “thorough investigation” of any violations.

;

;About a week later, the National Health Commission announced a year-long “rectification campaign” for the medical sector in a video conference held jointly with the education and public security ministries, as well as the General Audit Office.

;

;Chinese public fear repeat abuse of flood relief funds after latest disaster

;

;Further political momentum was injected into the campaign on July 28, when China's top anti-corruption agency – the party's Central Commission for Discipline Inspection (CCDI) – held a video conference calling on inspectors and supervisors to double their efforts.

;

;The crackdown was “essential in promoting the healthy China strategy by Xi Jinping”, the watchdog said.

;

;Nearly 300 billion yuan evaporated from the medical sector's market value in the six trading days after the CCDI meeting, according to Wind, a financial data provider in China.

;

;How China could use its rare disease burden to its 'advantage'

;

;Deng Yuwen, a former deputy editor of the Central Party School's official newspaper Study Times, said Xi has set his sights on the medical sector because it has been a major source of public grievances.

;

;“Xi knows these are the things close to people's hearts.过去五年来，他一直试图解决房价飞涨和补习行业带来的不平等问题。 He is now going to take on healthcare,” Deng said.

;

;High medical costs are one of the three “major burdens” – alongside housing and education – imposed on the Chinese public. Complaints from patients about unaffordable medical costs, for even mild illnesses, are long-standing and widespread.

;

;It has been an open secret that some pharmaceutical companies bribe hospital bosses and party secretaries for sales. Kickbacks are sometimes hard to investigate because they may be disguised as sponsorship or invitations to medical conferences.

;

;Post-Covid, more Chinese put health, family above professional success: survey

;

;Xie Maosong, a senior researcher at Tsinghua University's National Institute of Strategic Studies, said that while the post-pandemic clean-up might have triggered the campaign, it was long overdue.

;

;The campaign also showed that Xi was ready to move on in the drive to clean up the house, Xie said. The anti-corruption focus has been a feature of Xi's presidency, with health the latest sector to come under the spotlight.

;

;Health spending in China has outpaced income growth, with the rapidly ageing population having to spend more to manage chronic conditions. Hospitals are known to sell branded medicines at steep mark-ups to make up for shortfalls in public funding.

;

;“China now faces some serious and chronic problems and consumption is weak because people worry about their mortgages, kids' education and their medical bills,” Xie said.

;

;“So Beijing is trying to take on these problems one by one, hoping that their resolution will help put people's minds at ease so they will become more willing to spend.”

; Sat, 12 Aug 2023 14:20:01 +0800 India’s Hindu-Muslim hate crimes are being tracked, by self-exiles Modi supporters wants silencedhttps://www.scmp.com/week-asia/people/article/3230868/indias-hindu-muslim-hate-crimes-are-being-tracked-self-exiles-modi-supporters-wants-silenced?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.08.12 14:00;
;;

;Sectarian violence exploded in Haryana this month as Hindu nationalists clashed with local Muslims on the streets of the state that encircles India's capital on three sides.

;

;In Nuh district, a mere 90-minute drive from the nation's parliament, cars were set ablaze, shops were ransacked and the crackle of gunfire filled the air. By Sunday last week, six people had been killed – right on New Delhi's doorstep.

;

;On the other side of the world, a group of 20-somethings scattered across North America and Europe got to work scouring social media for evidence of who or what might have lit the fuse.

;

;Five hours – and incalculable gigabytes of data – later they had found what they were looking for: a speech given moments before the violence erupted by a Hindu-nationalist leader aligned with Prime Minister Narendra Modi's Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP), insisting that Muslims had no place in Nuh and calling for the region's “character” to be changed.

;

;They shared their find on X, the platform formerly known as Twitter, and within 12 hours it had notched up half a million views and been retweeted and shared thousands of times. No other media organisation had reported on the speech before.

;

;The scoop marked another in a long line of hate-crime exposés by the group, which calls itself Hindutva Watch (HW) in reference to the Hindu-nationalist ideology that seeks to make Hindu culture dominant throughout multicultural India.

;

;For two years, HW has chronicled unreported hate crimes, speeches and violence against India's religious minorities – including those being committed in remote towns and villages far away from the mainstream media spotlight.

;

;The 11-member team of online researchers – spread across the United States, Canada and Europe – are primarily volunteers, but they have had an outsize impact on Indian political discourse. No fewer than nine of their reports documenting instances of police failing to act against communal violence were cited in a recent Supreme Court petition urging more preventive action.

;

;In Modi's India, families of Muslims killed by Hindu mobs lose hope for justice

;

;Yet HW is now at risk of being hounded out of existence by the Modi government with its repeated attempts to get the group's posts, and account, wiped from the Elon Musk-owned X platform via take-down notices. Musk said in June that he was keen to make a “significant investment” in India “as soon as humanly possible” after meeting with Modi during the latter's state visit to the US.

;

;In the weeks since, HW has received seven notices from X and on August 3 – days after it had highlighted the role Hindu nationalists played in stoking violence in Haryana – two of its posts reporting on hate speech in that state as well as anti- “Love Jihad” weapons training in northeastern Assam were removed from the platform in India. Love Jihad is an alleged practice in which Muslim men target Hindu women for conversion to Islam through marriage.

;

;The notices sent to HW by X, and reviewed by This Week in Asia, set forth Indian government authorities' insistence that content shared by the group be taken down for “violating India's Information Technology Act”, without providing further details.

;

;This Week in Asia reached out to X for a comment, but did not receive a response.

;

;In June, police in the western state of Maharashtra filed a complaint against HW, accusing the group of “promoting enmity between different religious groups” and “injuring or defiling a place of worship with intent to insult the religion of any class” after it posted a video showing a Hindu nationalist giving a speech calling for Hindus to “unite” to protect Hindu families, amid tensions between Hindus and Muslims in the area.

;

;The charges carry a maximum term of five years in prison, in addition to a fine.

;

;“The Modi government has declared a war on us,” said Raqib Hameed Naik, HW's Washington DC-based founder. “We are staring at a suspension or our account being withheld in India.”

;

;

;

;Since Modi rose to power almost a decade ago, there has been a spike in hate speech, riots and lynchings committed by Hindu nationalists against India's minority groups. Data compiled by Indian tracking group Hate Crime Watch in 2019 showed that some 91 per cent of all hate crimes reported over the previous 10 years had occurred since Modi took power in 2014.

;

;But it's becoming ever harder to track religious hate crimes in India.曾试图这样做的两个数据库——一个由《印度斯坦时报》运营，另一个由专注于数据的出版物 IndiaSpend 发起的“仇恨犯罪观察”——分别于 2017 年和 2019 年停止运行。 Both had come under sustained criticism from Hindu nationalists, with Modi's ruling BJP reportedly unhappy at their tracking efforts.

;

;“The databases have been shut down and the mainstream media has largely abandoned their role in highlighting hate crimes and the whole Islamophobic ecosystem that operates behind it,” said Samar Halarnkar, founder and editor of civil-liberties news website Article14 and formerly editor of the Hate Crime Watch tracker before it closed.

;

;Halarnkar said there was now “a clear vacuum” when it came to reporting on hate crimes in India. “Also, if no one is tracking them, it's easy for the government to dismiss them as isolated incidents,” he said.

;

;HW's Naik cited this lack of readily available information as a major driver behind his group's efforts to create “a wall between the government's denial of the persecution of minorities and the reality” on the ground.

;

;Documenting hate crimes “runs contrary to the government's narrative that centres around this denial of the persecution”, he said, further asserting that “journalistic accuracy” was at the core of HW's work.

;

;Naik said every post the group puts out needs to have been confirmed by two separate sources of information, with the team monitoring the social-media accounts of hundreds of known Hindu nationalists across different states. Often, the hate speech and violence is live-streamed: something other outlets tend to overlook.

;

;“We have also developed a network of people across India who send us videos and photos of such events – including, often, local journalists who say their organisations won't let them report on the incident,” Naik said.

;

;

;

;Formerly a journalist in the conflict-ridden region of Jammu and Kashmir, Naik has seen first-hand the effects of violent Hindu nationalism.

;

;His family's home in Jammu was among the Kashmiri-owned properties and businesses attacked by Hindu-nationalist groups across India in 2019 in retribution for the suicide bombing of a bus in Kashmir, which killed 44 Indian paramilitary personnel.

;

;A year later, Naik decided to move to the US: spurred on by the Modi government's crackdown on critical media outlets, with Kashmiri journalists a routine target. India languishes near the bottom of Reporters Without Borders' World Press Freedom Index, ranking 161 out of 180 countries this year, down from No 150 in 2022.

;

;Modi's government raided the offices of the BBC in India earlier this year – ostensibly over a tax issue – weeks after Britain's national broadcaster had aired an investigative documentary highlighting his complicity in riots that killed more than 1,000 people, mostly Muslims, in Gujarat while he was the state's chief minister.

;

;“If I was in India, I would have been behind bars right now,” said Naik, explaining why he had chosen to establish HW in the US.

;

;His team – “all Indians, an equal mix of Hindus and Muslims, who deeply care about what is happening in India” – choose to remain anonymous for fear of retribution and are all based outside the country.

;

;But physical distance isn't always enough. Members of Naik's family back in Jammu and Kashmir have repeatedly been “hounded” by local police, he said, while HW's X account is routinely targeted by organised groups of Hindu nationalists who seek to get it taken down by mass reporting alleged abuses.

;

;And now with the police complaint, plus stiff government opposition, Naik knows the road ahead will not be easy.

;

;India accused of shaping 'compliant' online media amid ban over BBC's Modi film

;

;His team are braced for the worst – an enforced shut down of their X account, with its more than 71,000 followers. Naik said he plans to mount a legal challenge through the US courts if Musk's social media company takes any action against it.

;

;The team would carry on regardless, he said, and continue with its work of building a database of religious hate crimes in India. HW is slated to release its first-ever research report soon on the broader trends surrounding violent Hindu nationalism, even as it regularly publishes video evidence of hate crimes from across the country.

;

;“These are some of the darkest days in the history of India,” Naik said. “We need to archive these visuals closely.”

;;2023.08.12 12:46;

;Hong Kong's technology chief on Saturday conceded Washington's restrictions on US investments in sensitive Chinese technologies would bring “short-term” difficulty to his government's drive to attract businesses and talent as well as financing for local firms.

;

;Secretary for Innovation, Technology and Industry Sun Dong pledged to counter the US measures by broadening financing sources for local start-ups and considering more direct monetary support for strategically important technology firms.

;

;US President Joe Biden's executive order unveiled on Wednesday seeks to restrict US venture capital and private equity investments in Chinese firms in semiconductors and microelectronics, quantum information technologies and certain artificial intelligence systems.

;

;The restrictions, expected to come into force in about a year, will cover companies in Hong Kong and Macau. The Hong Kong government has slammed the measures as “unreasonable”, with Sun admitting the US curbs would have an impact on businesses in the city.

;

;“In the short term, especially in terms of investment, it can't be ruled out that some of our innovation and technology companies will encounter a bit of difficulty in financing,” Sun told reporters after a radio interview.

;

;Hong Kong, mainland to create plan 'within months' for bay area data transfer deal

;

;He told the radio programme the government might also face short-term challenges in bringing in leading technology firms and talent, a bid that is part of Chief Executive John Lee Ka-chiu's economic policy.

;

;But Sun reaffirmed his faith in the city's technology ambitions in the long run: “The revolution of a new generation of technologies and industries will not stop because of this. I believe it will not change the global development pattern of the rise of the East and the decline of the West.”

;

;The technology minister pledged to tap into more funding sources for tech firms in Hong Kong, such as venture capital from mainland China. The government will also ramp up financial support for strategically key tech firms, though he said local officials had to take bolder approaches to compete with other places.

;

;“In Singapore, the mainland, or even Europe and the US, key enterprises receive [government] money as subsidies, not as investment. But as the Hong Kong government has not adopted such a culture, we are conducting studies on the practice of offering cash subsidies,” he said.

;

;New website to connect Hong Kong's researchers with investors in mainland China

;

;Lee's administration has set up a HK$5 billion (US$639.6 million) Strategic Tech Fund, with another HK$3 billion earmarked in this year's budget plan to enhance basic exploration in frontier fields such as artificial intelligence and quantum technology.

;

;Local lawmakers have previously called for more government support in start-up financing as they worried that the US measures would undermine the appeal of Hong Kong tech firms to investors, resulting in some companies exiting the city.

;

;High chance Beijing will agree to research and development transfers to Hong Kong

;

;Sun meanwhile said the academic circle had been affected by the fallout from the US-China tech war, adding university professors had for years faced “a lot of restrictions” when applying for visas to attend overseas conferences.

;

;While Hong Kong also faces a high turnover rate in researchers and academics, the technology chief on Saturday gave assurance that efforts were being made to stem the academic brain drain.

;

;With Beijing's backing and development plans such as the San Tin Technopole and a new microelectronics institute, Sun urged faith in Hong Kong's vision in building an innovation and technology hub.

;

;“We must continue to uphold Hong Kong's international advantages, and continue to maintain a cultural and business environment that everyone feels is relaxed and free,” he added.
